Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods

Class Prometheus

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods.GodStrategy
it.polimi.ingsw.model.gods.Prometheus
public class Prometheus
extends GodStrategy
This class implements the Prometheus strategy used by the Player who chose the powers of this God. Specifically, if the selected Worker does not move up, it can build both before and after moving.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private boolean builtBeforeMoving
    Flag used to check if Prometheus built before moving or not.

    void executeBuild​(Worker worker, Cell buildCell, BlockType buildCellBlockType)
    Decorates the standard executeBuild increasing the build count of MultipleBuildDelegate and setting to true the flag that indicates if Prometheus power was activated, if the worker hasn't already performed a move.
    void executeMove​(Worker worker, Cell moveCell)
    This method only moves to Worker to the specified moveCell and, if the Player didn't build before this movement, we set the selected Worker as the Worker which performed this movement.

  • Method Details

    • checkBuild

      public boolean checkBuild​(Worker worker, Cell buildCell, BlockType buildCellBlockType)
      If the Player is trying to perform a Build BEFORE the Move phase, Prometheus power is activated. Otherwise, MultipleBuildDelegate checkBuild is called.
      Overrides:
      checkBuild in class GodStrategy
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker who want to build a new level.
      buildCell - the cell in which the Player want to build a new level.
      buildCellBlockType - [optional] the level that the Worker wants to build.
      Returns:
      true if the Build passed as parameter can be performed, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      MultipleBuildDelegate.checkBuild(Worker, Cell, BlockType, Worker)

    • checkMove

      public boolean checkMove​(Worker worker, Cell moveCell)
      If the worker did not build before moving, Prometheus power is not activated and superclass (standard) checkMove is called. Otherwise, the method checks that the Worker isn't going to a higher level. In this case we can't use standard GodStrategy checkMove because it would check that the worker hasn't already build, so it would always fail.
      Overrides:
      checkMove in class GodStrategy
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker that the Player wants to move.
      moveCell - the cell in which the Player want to move the worker.
      Returns:
      true if the Move passed as parameter can be performed, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      GodStrategy.checkMove(Worker, Cell)

    • executeMove

      public void executeMove​(Worker worker, Cell moveCell)
      This method only moves to Worker to the specified moveCell and, if the Player didn't build before this movement, we set the selected Worker as the Worker which performed this movement. In fact, in this case, Prometheus follows the regular game rules.
      Overrides:
      executeMove in class GodStrategy
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker that the Player wants to move.
      moveCell - the cell in which the Player want to move the worker.
      See Also:
      GodStrategy.executeMove(Worker, Cell)

    • executeBuild

      public void executeBuild​(Worker worker, Cell buildCell, BlockType buildCellBlockType)
      Decorates the standard executeBuild increasing the build count of MultipleBuildDelegate and setting to true the flag that indicates if Prometheus power was activated, if the worker hasn't already performed a move.
      Overrides:
      executeBuild in class GodStrategy
      Parameters:
      worker - the worker who want to build a new level.
      buildCell - the cell in which the Player want to build a new level.
      buildCellBlockType - [optional] the level that the Worker wants to build.
      See Also:
      GodStrategy.executeBuild(Worker, Cell, BlockType)

    • checkEndTurn

      public boolean checkEndTurn()
      This method is called to check that, if Prometheus built before move, also a build action after the move has been performed.
      Overrides:
      checkEndTurn in class GodStrategy
      Returns:
      true if Prometheus can end its turn, false otherwise.

    • endPlayerTurn

      public void endPlayerTurn​(Player player)
      Calls superclass endTurn and resets delegates properties.
      Overrides:
      endPlayerTurn in class GodStrategy
      Parameters:
      player - The player whose turn is ending.
      See Also:
      GodStrategy.endPlayerTurn(Player)
